results.title: Winners : Room to Move (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a dedicated runner, coached by her father, day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance. But Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed, but at several things. She rebels and plans a new life for herself. But the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners : Quest beyond time
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Julia Overton, Richard Mason and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
The Sickness has come to Clan Murray. They call on the gods for assistance, which arrives in the form of Mike and his hang-glider. He is the man who can fly. With Katrin of the Clan Murray he sets out on a quest for help through a savage land Australia in the post-nuclear Dark Age. Rated: G

results.title: Winners : Quest beyond time (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A flight on his hang glider sends Mike 500 years into a post-nuclear Dark Age. When a Chieftain tells him of the Holocaust he’s convinced he’s landed in a lunatic asylum. The Clan Murray are victims of the Sickness and Mike agrees to accompany a young woman warrior on a quest with many dangers. Finally they must cross a sea of nuclear waste to find a cure. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners : On Loan (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Bennett, Patricia Edgar, Jane Scott and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Vietnamese born, Lindy, is adopted by an Australian family who believe she is an orphan. Following her fourteenth birthday, she receives a letter from her natural father. Lindy has to decide between two families and two futures, Australia or Vietnam. Part of the “Winners” Series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Bennett, Patricia Edgar, Jane Scott and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Winners : Just friends
results.creator_credit: Michael Pattinson, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Winners Series”.
Susan has just moved to a new part of town. It’s school holidays and she goes to practice her skills at the local roller rink. Buzz, the Prince of the rink, spots the talented newcomer and moves in on her. Susan joins Buzz and his gang - but she doesn’t know what she is letting herself in for. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Pattinson, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.
results.description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.
description_for_label: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel → Outback Australia

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Konigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a claerly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Konigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: Tor Schwanck: gold and silversmith
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”
Metal-work has been in Tor Schwanck’s family since the 15th century. He is an artisan trained in all aspects of metal-work. Schwanck uses non-precious metals as well as gold and silver. All the designs are originals, and he tours, exhibits and receives commissions for his work.
